page.title: 12GENERAL SUMMARY
page.content: The whole area is{agricultural,}mainly livestock with a little wheat and barley. Land is intensively farmed by families working several farms in co-operation. Many families have farmed the area for several generations. Apart from agricultural land the area{is dotted with small {enclosed deciduous woodland.}There is an 18th century Hall, a 16th century Manor, several half-timbered black and white houses and a{Roman road}dividing the area and linking Droitwich with Alcester. There is a{twice-daily bus {service.}The railway line and canal cross this road, the canal now used for leisure purposes. The station and brickworks have both been closed for several years. Broughton Green still maintains a cluster of houses around a small Anglican Chapel, but there are no other amenities there.
